<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_binary_format/architecture"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **binary_format/architecture** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_binary_format/architecture)

Application executable architecture.

Supported architectures: ``x86_32``, ``x86_64``, ``arm64``, ``arm32``, ``rv64``, ``ppc64``, and ``loongarch64``.

Official export templates include ``x86_32``, ``x86_64``, ``arm32``, and ``arm64`` binaries only.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_binary_format/embed_pck"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **binary_format/embed_pck** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_binary_format/embed_pck)

If ``true``, project resources are embedded into the executable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_custom_template/debug"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **custom_template/debug** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_custom_template/debug)

Path to the custom export template. If left empty, default template is used.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_custom_template/release"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **custom_template/release** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_custom_template/release)

Path to the custom export template. If left empty, default template is used.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_debug/export_console_wrapper"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **debug/export_console_wrapper** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_debug/export_console_wrapper)

If ``true``, a console wrapper is exported alongside the main executable, which allows running the project with enabled console output.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_shader_baker/enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **shader_baker/enabled** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_shader_baker/enabled)

If ``true``, shaders will be compiled and embedded in the application. This option is only supported when using the Forward+ or Mobile renderers.

\ **Note:** When exporting as a dedicated server, the shader baker is always disabled since no rendering is performed.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/cleanup_script"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **ssh_remote_deploy/cleanup_script** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/cleanup_script)

Script code to execute on the remote host when app is finished.

The following variables can be used in the script:

- ``{temp_dir}`` - Path of temporary folder on the remote, used to upload app and scripts to.

- ``{archive_name}`` - Name of the ZIP containing uploaded application.

- ``{exe_name}`` - Name of application executable.

- ``{cmd_args}`` - Array of the command line argument for the application.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **ssh_remote_deploy/enabled** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/enabled)

Enables remote deploy using SSH/SCP.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/extra_args_scp"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **ssh_remote_deploy/extra_args_scp** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/extra_args_scp)

Array of the additional command line arguments passed to the SCP.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/extra_args_ssh"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **ssh_remote_deploy/extra_args_ssh** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/extra_args_ssh)

Array of the additional command line arguments passed to the SSH.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/host"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **ssh_remote_deploy/host** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/host)

Remote host SSH user name and address, in ``user@address`` format.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/port"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **ssh_remote_deploy/port** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/port)

Remote host SSH port number.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/run_script"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](String.md) **ssh_remote_deploy/run_script** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_ssh_remote_deploy/run_script)

Script code to execute on the remote host when running the app.

The following variables can be used in the script:

- ``{temp_dir}`` - Path of temporary folder on the remote, used to upload app and scripts to.

- ``{archive_name}`` - Name of the ZIP containing uploaded application.

- ``{exe_name}`` - Name of application executable.

- ``{cmd_args}`` - Array of the command line argument for the application.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_texture_format/etc2_astc"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **texture_format/etc2_astc** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_texture_format/etc2_astc)

If ``true``, project textures are exported in the ETC2/ASTC format.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_texture_format/s3tc_bptc"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **texture_format/s3tc_bptc** [ðŸ”—](#EditorExportPlatformLinuxBSD_property_texture_format/s3tc_bptc)

If ``true``, project textures are exported in the S3TC/BPTC format.
